001package org.biopax.ols.impl;
002
003import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
004import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
005import org.biopax.ols.Annotation;
006import org.biopax.ols.Constants;
007import org.biopax.ols.DbXref;
008import org.biopax.ols.Loader;
009import org.biopax.ols.Ontology;
010import org.biopax.ols.Parser;
011import org.biopax.ols.Term;
012import org.biopax.ols.TermPath;
013import org.biopax.ols.TermRelationship;
014import org.biopax.ols.TermSynonym;
015import org.obo.datamodel.*;
016
017
018
019import java.io.IOException;
020import java.util.*;
021
022/**
023 * Base class for all loaders. This class will perform OBO-to-OLS object conversion, creating all relevant
024 * objects. Three methods are listed as abstract: configure, parse and printusage, which depend on the OBO
025 * format being used (GOFF or OBO).
026 *
027 * @author Richard Cote
028 */
029public abstract class BaseOBO2AbstractLoader implements Loader {
030    protected static Log logger = LogFactory.getLog(BaseOBO2AbstractLoader.class);
031    protected HashMap<String, Term> ontologyTerms = new HashMap<>(5000);
032    protected String ONTOLOGY_DEFINITION;
033    protected String FULL_NAME;
034    protected String SHORT_NAME;
035    protected String QUERY_URL = null;
036    protected String SOURCE_URL = null;
037    protected OntologyBean ontBean = null;
038
039    //common objects
040    protected TermBean IS_A = null;
041    protected TermBean PART_OF = null;
042    protected TermBean DEVELOPS_FROM = null;
043    protected TermBean ALT_ID = null;
044    protected TermBean EXACT = null;
045    protected TermBean NARROW = null;
046    protected TermBean BROAD = null;
047    protected TermBean RELATED = null;
048    protected TermBean SYNONYM = null;
049    protected final HashSet<String> PART_OF_SET = new HashSet<>();
050    protected final HashSet<String> IS_A_SET = new HashSet<>();
051    protected final HashSet<String> DEV_FROM_SET = new HashSet<>();
052    private HashMap<String, Term> unknown_relations = new HashMap<>();
053    private TreeSet<String> rootTerms = new TreeSet<>();
054    protected Parser parser;
055
056    //for PSI-MOD
057    private Set<String> MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS = null;
058    private Set<String> MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS = null;
059
060
061    /**
062     * batch mode will optimize inserts. set to false if having wonky errors or rdbms does not support it.
063     */
064    protected static final boolean BATCH_MODE = true;
065
066    protected void setParser(Parser parser) {
067        this.parser = parser;
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * determine which root detection algorithm will be used
072     */
073    protected boolean useGreedy = false;
074
075    protected void setUseGreedy(boolean useGreedy) {
076        this.useGreedy = useGreedy;
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * will return a collection of TermBean accesssion strings that correspond to the root term
081     *
082     * @throws IllegalStateException if the parser has not been initialized
083     */
084    protected Collection<String> getRootTerms() {
085        HashSet<String> retval = new HashSet<>();
086        if (parser != null) {
087            Set<OBOObject> roots = parser.getRootTerms(useGreedy);
088            if (roots != null) {
089                for (OBOObject root : roots) {
090                    retval.add(safeTrim(root.getID()));
091                }
092            }
093        } else {
094            throw new IllegalStateException("Parser has not been initialized. Did you run configure()?");
095        }
096        return retval;
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Will iterate through all parsed terms and generate memory structure suitable for loading to db
101     *
102     * @throws IllegalStateException if the parser has not been initialized
103     */
104    protected void process() {
105        //returns unmodifiable set, so need to create a modifiable one
106        Set<OBOObject> terms = new HashSet<>();
107
108        //sanity check
109        if (parser == null) {
110            throw new IllegalStateException("parser has not been initialized. Did you run configure()?");
111        }
112
113        //tmp collection to store terms
114        Collection<OBOObject> toAdd;
115
116        //add all terms - this will include obsolete and roots
117        //sanity check to avoid NPE
118        toAdd = parser.getTerms();
119        if (toAdd != null) {
120            terms.addAll(toAdd);
121        }
122
123        //create common objects needed to build references and synonyms
124        initializeCommonObjects();
125
126        //process all terms
127        logger.info("Total Terms to process: " + terms.size());
128
129        int count = 0;
130        for (Object obj : terms) {
131            count++;
132            if (obj instanceof OBOObject) {
133                processTerm((OBOObject) obj);
134                if (count % 1000 == 0) {
135                    logger.debug("Terms Processed: " + count);
136                }
137            } else {
138                logger.info("Ignored object: " + obj.toString());
139            }
140        }
141        logger.info("Term processing done");
142
143        //need to iterate again to build relationships
144        logger.info("Creating relationships");
145        count = 0;
146        for (Object obj : terms) {
147            count++;
148            if (obj instanceof OBOObject) {
149                processTermRelationships((OBOObject) obj);
150                if (count % 1000 == 0) {
151                    logger.debug("Relationships Processed: " + count);
152                }
153            } else {
154                logger.info("Ignored object: " + obj.toString());
155            }
156        }
157        logger.info("Relationship processing done");
158
159        //add to OntologyAccess
160        ontBean.setTerms(ontologyTerms.values());
161    }
162
163
164    /**
165     * inetrnal helper method to initialize and reset shared objects
166     */
167    protected void initializeCommonObjects() {
168        //no need to check if parser is not null because
169        //of previous sanity check at the start of process()
170
171        //this is not true in the cast of the NEWT loader!!!
172        String version;
173        if (parser != null) {
174            version = parser.getSession().getCurrentHistory().getVersion();
175
176            //if version is not set, set it to file date
177            if (version == null) {
178                Date tmp = parser.getSession().getCurrentHistory().getDate();
179                //if date is not set, set it to current date
180                if (tmp != null)
181                    version = tmp.toString();
182                else
183                    version = (new Date()).toString();
184            }
185
186        } else {
187            version = (new Date()).toString();
188        }
189
190        //create ontology
191        ontBean = new OntologyBean();
192        if (ONTOLOGY_DEFINITION != null && ONTOLOGY_DEFINITION.length() > 2000) {
193            logger.warn("ontology definition longer than allowed database column length - truncating");
194            ONTOLOGY_DEFINITION = ONTOLOGY_DEFINITION.substring(0, 2000);
195        }
196        ontBean.setDefinition(ONTOLOGY_DEFINITION);
197
198        if (FULL_NAME != null && FULL_NAME.length() > 128) {
199            logger.warn("ontology full name longer than allowed database column length - truncating");
200            FULL_NAME = FULL_NAME.substring(0, 128);
201        }
202        ontBean.setFullOntologyName(FULL_NAME);
203
204        ontBean.setLoadDate(new java.sql.Date(GregorianCalendar.getInstance().getTime().getTime()));
205
206        if (SHORT_NAME != null && SHORT_NAME.length() > 32) {
207            logger.warn("ontology short name longer than allowed database column length - truncating");
208            SHORT_NAME = SHORT_NAME.substring(0, 32);
209        }
210        ontBean.setShortOntologyName(SHORT_NAME);
211
212        if (version != null && version.length() > 128) {
213            logger.warn("ontology version longer than allowed database column length - truncating");
214            version = version.substring(0, 128);
215        }
216        ontBean.setVersion(version);
217
218        ontBean.setFullyLoaded(false);
219
220        if (QUERY_URL != null && QUERY_URL.length() > 255) {
221            logger.warn("ontology query url longer than allowed database column length - truncating");
222            QUERY_URL = QUERY_URL.substring(0, 255);
223        }
224        ontBean.setQueryURL(QUERY_URL);
225
226        if (SOURCE_URL != null && SOURCE_URL.length() > 255) {
227            logger.warn("ontology source url longer than allowed database column length - truncating");
228            SOURCE_URL = SOURCE_URL.substring(0, 255);
229        }
230        ontBean.setSourceURL(SOURCE_URL);
231
232        //make certain there's no dirty data (esp if we're using it to load multiple ontologies)
233        ontologyTerms.clear();
234
235        //create mapping sets
236        IS_A_SET.clear();
237        IS_A_SET.add(Constants.IS_A_RELATION_TYPE);
238        IS_A_SET.add(Constants.IS_A_RELATION_TYPE.toUpperCase());
239        //other mappings seen
240        IS_A_SET.add("isa");
241        IS_A_SET.add("ISA");
242        IS_A_SET.add("OBO_REL:is_a");
243
244        PART_OF_SET.clear();
245        PART_OF_SET.add(Constants.PART_OF_RELATION_TYPE);
246        PART_OF_SET.add(Constants.PART_OF_RELATION_TYPE.toUpperCase());
247        //other mappings seen
248        PART_OF_SET.add("partof");
249        PART_OF_SET.add("PARTOF");
250        PART_OF_SET.add("OBO_REL:part_of");
251        PART_OF_SET.add("is_part_of");
252
253        DEV_FROM_SET.clear();
254        DEV_FROM_SET.add(Constants.DEVELOPS_FROM_RELATION_TYPE);
255        DEV_FROM_SET.add(Constants.DEVELOPS_FROM_RELATION_TYPE.toUpperCase());
256        //other mappings seen
257        DEV_FROM_SET.add("DERIVED/DEVELOPS_FROM");
258
259        //set PSI-MOD specific xrefs that will be converted to annotations
260        MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS = new HashSet<String>();
261        MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS.add("DiffAvg");
262        MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS.add("DiffMono");
263        MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS.add("MassAvg");
264        MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS.add("MassMono");
265
266        MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS = new HashSet<String>();
267        MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.add("DiffFormula");
268        MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.add("Formula");
269        MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.add("Source");
270        MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.add("Origin");
271        MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.add("TermSpec");
272
273        //create relations
274        IS_A = initializeTermBean(Constants.IS_A_RELATION_TYPE, Loader.RELATION_TYPE);
275        ontologyTerms.put(IS_A.getIdentifier(), IS_A);
276        PART_OF = initializeTermBean(Constants.PART_OF_RELATION_TYPE, Loader.RELATION_TYPE);
277        ontologyTerms.put(PART_OF.getIdentifier(), PART_OF);
278        DEVELOPS_FROM = initializeTermBean(Constants.DEVELOPS_FROM_RELATION_TYPE, Loader.RELATION_TYPE);
279        ontologyTerms.put(DEVELOPS_FROM.getIdentifier(), DEVELOPS_FROM);
280
281        //create synonyms
282        ALT_ID = initializeTermBean(Constants.ALT_ID_SYNONYM_TYPE, Loader.SYNONYM_TYPE);
283        ontologyTerms.put(ALT_ID.getIdentifier(), ALT_ID);
284
285        EXACT = initializeTermBean(Constants.EXACT_SYNONYM_TYPE, Loader.SYNONYM_TYPE);
286        ontologyTerms.put(EXACT.getIdentifier(), EXACT);
287
288        NARROW = initializeTermBean(Constants.NARROW_SYNONYM_TYPE, Loader.SYNONYM_TYPE);
289        ontologyTerms.put(NARROW.getIdentifier(), NARROW);
290
291        BROAD = initializeTermBean(Constants.BROAD_SYNONYM_TYPE, Loader.SYNONYM_TYPE);
292        ontologyTerms.put(BROAD.getIdentifier(), BROAD);
293
294        RELATED = initializeTermBean(Constants.RELATED_SYNONYM_TYPE, Loader.SYNONYM_TYPE);
295        ontologyTerms.put(RELATED.getIdentifier(), RELATED);
296
297        SYNONYM = initializeTermBean(Constants.DEFAULT_SYNONYM_TYPE, Loader.SYNONYM_TYPE);
298        ontologyTerms.put(SYNONYM.getIdentifier(), SYNONYM);
299
300        //initialize synonymTypeDefs
301        if (parser != null) {
302            Collection<SynonymType> synonymTypes = parser.getSession().getSynonymTypes();
303            if (synonymTypes != null && !synonymTypes.isEmpty()) {
304                for (SynonymType st : synonymTypes) {
305                    ontologyTerms.put(st.getID(), initializeTermBean(st.getName(), SHORT_NAME + ":" + st.getID(), getSynonymTypeDef(st.getScope())));
306                }
307            }
308        }
309
310//        //get rid of stale data
311//        instances.clear();
312
313        //get rid of stale data and get root terms
314        rootTerms.clear();
315        if (parser != null) {
316            rootTerms.addAll(getRootTerms());
317        }
318
319    }
320
321
322    /**
323     * helper method to create a TermBean given a name and a definition. This is mostly for terms
324     * associated with an ontology but not defined by it (eg relations types, synonym types, etc)
325     *
326     * @param name - this value will be used to set the term.name and term.identifier
327     * @param def  - the term definition.
328     * @return a valid TermBean object
329     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the term name is null.
330     */
331    private TermBean initializeTermBean(String name, String def) {
332        if (name != null && !"".equals(name.trim())) {
333            TermBean bean = new TermBean();
334            bean.setName(name.trim());
335            bean.setIdentifier(SHORT_NAME + ":" + name.toUpperCase().trim());
336            bean.setDefinition(safeTrim(def));
337            bean.setParentOntology(ontBean);
338            //must set PK here because OJB will now not set it automatically
339            //PK will be term_ac+ont+fully_loaded_false
340            bean.setTermPk(bean.getIdentifier() + SHORT_NAME + "0");
341            return bean;
342        } else {
343            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have a non-null term name!");
344        }
345    }
346
347    /**
348     * helper method to create a TermBean given a name, an accession and a definition.
349     *
350     * @param name      - this value will be used to set the term.name
351     * @param accession - this value will be used to set the term.identifier
352     * @param def       - the term definition. 
353     * @return a valid TermBean object
354     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the term name or accession is null.
355     */
356    protected TermBean initializeTermBean(String name, String accession, String def) {
357        if (accession != null && !"".equals(accession.trim())) {
358            TermBean bean = initializeTermBean(name, def);
359            bean.setIdentifier(accession.trim());
360            bean.setTermPk(bean.getIdentifier() + SHORT_NAME + "0");
361            return bean;
362        } else {
363            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have a non-null term name!");
364        }
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * This method will convert an OBOEdit model term into a valid TermBean, while creating synonyms,
369     * xrefs and annotations. The valid TermBean generated will be added to a global HashMap that will
370     * be used at a later stage.
371     *
372     * @param obj being an OBOObject object obtained from the parser
373     */
374    protected void processTerm(OBOObject obj) {
375
376        if (obj.getID().startsWith("obo:")) {
377            /*
378                obo:datatype
379                obo:property
380                obo:class
381            */
382            logger.debug("bogus term: " + obj.getID());
383            return;
384        }
385
386        TermBean trm = new TermBean();
387        //must set PK here because OJB will now not set it automatically
388        //PK will be term_ac+ont+fully_loaded_false
389        trm.setTermPk(safeTrim(obj.getID()) + SHORT_NAME + "0");
390        if (trm.getTermPk().length() > 255) {
391            throw new IllegalStateException("term PK longer than allowed database column length: " + trm.getTermPk());
392        }
393
394        //trim definition 
395        trm.setDefinition(safeTrim(obj.getDefinition()));
396        if (trm.getDefinition() != null && trm.getDefinition().length() > 4000) {
397            logger.warn("term definition longer than allowed database column length - truncating" + trm.getIdentifier());
398            trm.setDefinition(trm.getDefinition().substring(0, 4000));
399        }
400
401        //trim ID 
402        trm.setIdentifier(safeTrim(obj.getID()));
403        if (trm.getIdentifier() != null && trm.getIdentifier().length() > 255) {
404            logger.warn("term identifier longer than allowed database column length - truncating" + trm.getIdentifier());
405            trm.setIdentifier(trm.getIdentifier().substring(0, 255));
406        }
407        //set as root term if required
408        if (rootTerms.contains(safeTrim(obj.getID()))) {
409            trm.setRootTerm(true);
410            logger.info(obj.getID() + " is a root term");
411        }
412        //trim name 
413        trm.setName(safeTrim(obj.getName()));
414        //trim namespace 
415        if (trm.getName() != null && trm.getName().length() > 2000) {
416            logger.warn("term name longer than allowed database column length - truncating" + trm.getIdentifier());
417            trm.setName(trm.getName().substring(0, 2000));
418        }
419
420        Namespace nspace = obj.getNamespace();
421        if (nspace != null) {
422            trm.setNamespace(safeTrim(nspace.getID()));
423            if (trm.getNamespace() != null && trm.getNamespace().length() > 255) {
424                logger.warn("term namespace longer than allowed database column length - truncating" + trm.getIdentifier());
425                trm.setNamespace(trm.getNamespace().substring(0, 255));
426            }
427        }
428        //set if obsolete
429        trm.setObsolete(obj.isObsolete());
430        //set parent ontology
431        trm.setParentOntology(ontBean);
432        //process synonyms
433        trm.setSynonyms(processSynonyms(obj, trm));
434        //process xrefs
435        trm.setXrefs(processXrefs(obj, trm));
436        //process annotations
437        trm.setAnnotations(processAnnotations(obj, trm));
438
439        //set number of children
440        int nbChild = 0;
441        if (obj.getChildren() != null) {
442            nbChild = obj.getChildren().size();
443        }
444
445        //set leaf status
446        if (nbChild > 0) {
447            trm.setLeaf(false);
448        } else {
449            trm.setLeaf(true);
450        }
451
452//        if (obj instanceof Instance) {
453//            trm.setInstance(true);
454//            //store type (eg objID is_instance_of typeID
455//            instances.put(obj.getType().getID(), obj.getID());
456//        } else {
457//            trm.setInstance(false);
458//        }
459
460        //add to global storage
461        ontologyTerms.put(trm.getIdentifier(), trm);
462
463    }
464
465    /**
466     * internal method to create AnnotationBeans objects from values extracted from an OBOEdit term object
467     * and properly setup associations to the parent OLS term objet. Annotations can include comments and
468     * replacement term ids for obsolete or misused terms, as well as defined subsets.
469     *
470     * @param obj - the OBOEdit object to extract information from
471     * @param trm - the parent term to link the annotations to
472     * @return a collection of properly created AnnotationBeans
473     */
474    private Collection<Annotation> processAnnotations(OBOObject obj, TermBean trm) {
475
476        ArrayList<Annotation> retval = new ArrayList<Annotation>();
477
478        String comment = safeTrim(obj.getComment());
479        if (comment != null) {
480            AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
481            annot.setAnnotationStringValue(comment);
482            annot.setAnnotationType(Annotation.OBO_COMMENT);
483            if (comment != null && comment.length() > 2000) {
484                logger.warn("annotation comment longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
485                annot.setAnnotationStringValue(annot.getAnnotationStringValue().substring(0, 2000));
486            }
487
488            annot.setParentTerm(trm);
489            retval.add(annot);
490        }
491
492        Set<ObsoletableObject> considers = obj.getConsiderReplacements();
493        for (ObsoletableObject obsolete : considers) {
494            AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
495            annot.setAnnotationType(Annotation.OBO_CONSIDER_REPLACEMENT);
496            String val = obsolete.getID();
497            if (obsolete.getName() != null) {
498                val += ": " + obsolete.getName();
499            }
500            annot.setAnnotationStringValue(val);
501            if (val != null && val.length() > 2000) {
502                logger.warn("annotation value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
503                annot.setAnnotationStringValue(annot.getAnnotationStringValue().substring(0, 2000));
504            }
505            annot.setParentTerm(trm);
506            retval.add(annot);
507        }
508
509        Set<ObsoletableObject> replacers = obj.getReplacedBy();
510        for (ObsoletableObject replacedby : replacers) {
511            AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
512            annot.setAnnotationType(Annotation.OBO_REPLACED_BY);
513            String val = replacedby.getID();
514            if (replacedby.getName() != null) {
515                val += ": " + replacedby.getName();
516            }
517            annot.setAnnotationStringValue(val);
518            if (val != null && val.length() > 2000) {
519                logger.warn("annotation value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
520                annot.setAnnotationStringValue(annot.getAnnotationStringValue().substring(0, 2000));
521            }
522            annot.setParentTerm(trm);
523            retval.add(annot);
524        }
525
526        Set<TermSubset> subsets = obj.getSubsets();
527        for (TermSubset subset : subsets) {
528            AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
529            annot.setAnnotationType(Annotation.SUBSET + "_" + subset.getName());
530            String val = subset.getDesc();
531            annot.setAnnotationStringValue(val);
532            if (val != null && val.length() > 2000) {
533                logger.warn("annotation value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
534                annot.setAnnotationStringValue(annot.getAnnotationStringValue().substring(0, 2000));
535            }
536            annot.setParentTerm(trm);
537            retval.add(annot);
538        }
539
540        Set<PropertyValue> propVal = obj.getPropertyValues();
541        for (PropertyValue pv : propVal) {
542            AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
543            //property_value: EFO:definition_editor "James Malone" xsd:string
544            //parses to property = property_value
545            //             value = EFO:definition_editor "James Malone" xsd:string
546            //so manually process the value to something more informative
547            //          property = EFO:definition_editor
548            //             value = "James Malone"
549            try {
550                if (pv.getValue() == null) {
551                    //invalidly constucted property_value!
552                    logger.warn("Error parsing property_value - Ignoring null value: " + pv.toString());
553                    continue;
554                }
555
556                int ndx;
557
558                //parse property type
559                String tmpStr = pv.getValue();
560                ndx = tmpStr.indexOf(' ');
561                if (ndx > 0) {
562                    tmpStr = tmpStr.substring(0, ndx).trim();
563                    if (tmpStr.endsWith(":")) {
564                        tmpStr = tmpStr.substring(0, tmpStr.length() - 1);
565                    }
566                    logger.debug("Setting property type: " + tmpStr);
567                    annot.setAnnotationType(tmpStr.trim());
568                    if (annot.getAnnotationType() != null && annot.getAnnotationType().length() > 2000) {
569                        logger.warn("annotation type longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
570                        annot.setAnnotationType(annot.getAnnotationType().substring(0, 2000));
571                    }
572
573                    //parse property value
574                    tmpStr = pv.getValue();
575
576                    tmpStr = tmpStr.substring(ndx + 1);
577                    ndx = tmpStr.indexOf("xsd:");
578                    if (ndx > 0) {
579                        tmpStr = tmpStr.substring(0, ndx);
580                    }
581                    tmpStr = tmpStr.trim();
582                    if (tmpStr.startsWith("\"") && tmpStr.endsWith("\"")) {
583                        tmpStr = tmpStr.substring(1, tmpStr.length() - 1);
584                    }
585                    logger.debug("Setting property value: " + tmpStr.trim());
586                    annot.setAnnotationStringValue(tmpStr.trim());
587                    if (tmpStr != null && tmpStr.length() > 2000) {
588                        logger.warn("annotation value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
589                        annot.setAnnotationStringValue(annot.getAnnotationStringValue().substring(0, 2000));
590                    }
591
592                } else {
593
594                    //this will capture occations where people just put random key-value tags
595                    //as annotations
596                    annot.setAnnotationType(pv.getProperty());
597                    if (pv.getProperty() != null && pv.getProperty().length() > 2000) {
598                        logger.warn("annotation type longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
599                        annot.setAnnotationType(annot.getAnnotationType().substring(0, 2000));
600                    }
601                    annot.setAnnotationStringValue(pv.getValue());
602                    if (pv.getValue() != null && pv.getValue().length() > 2000) {
603                        logger.warn("annotation value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
604                        annot.setAnnotationStringValue(annot.getAnnotationStringValue().substring(0, 2000));
605                    }
606
607                }
608
609                annot.setParentTerm(trm);
610
611            } catch (RuntimeException re) {
612                logger.warn("Error parsing property_value - Ignoring : " + pv.toString());
613                logger.debug("pv.getProperty() = " + pv.getProperty());
614                logger.debug("pv.getValue() = " + pv.getValue());
615                continue;
616            }
617            retval.add(annot);
618        }
619
620        if ("MOD".equals(SHORT_NAME)) {
621
622            for (Object xrObj : obj.getDbxrefs()) {
623
624                Dbxref xref = (Dbxref) xrObj;
625                if (MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.contains(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()))) {
626                    //create string annotation
627                    AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
628                    annot.setAnnotationType(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()));
629                    annot.setAnnotationStringValue(safeTrim(xref.getDesc()));
630                    annot.setParentTerm(trm);
631                    retval.add(annot);
632                } else if (MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS.contains(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()))) {
633                    //create numeric annotation
634                    AnnotationBean annot = new AnnotationBean();
635                    annot.setAnnotationType(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()));
636                    annot.setAnnotationDoubleValue(safeTrim(xref.getDesc()));
637                    annot.setParentTerm(trm);
638                    retval.add(annot);
639                }
640            }
641        }
642
643        return retval;
644    }
645
646    /**
647     * internal method to create DbXrefBean objects from values extracted from an OBOEdit term object
648     * and properly setup associations to the parent OLS term objet. Xrefs will be generated for analog
649     * xrefs, definition xrefs and synonym xrefs.
650     *
651     * @param obj - the OBOEdit object to extract information from
652     * @param trm - the parent term to link the annotations to
653     * @return a collection of properly created DbXrefBean
654     */
655    private Collection<DbXref> processXrefs(OBOObject obj, TermBean trm) {
656
657        HashSet<DbXref> retval = new HashSet<DbXref>();
658        for (Object xrObj : obj.getDbxrefs()) {
659            Dbxref xref = (Dbxref) xrObj;
660
661            if (!"MOD".equals(SHORT_NAME)) {
662                //todo - hardcode analog for now and remove it when bug is fixed
663                //fix oboedit codebase error
664                retval.add(createDbXref(xref, Dbxref.ANALOG));
665            } else {
666                if (MOD_STRING_ANNOTATIONS.contains(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()))) {
667                    //do nothing - annotation will be created later
668                } else if (MOD_NUMERIC_ANNOTATIONS.contains(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()))) {
669                    //do nothing - annotation will be created later
670                } else {
671                    //todo - hardcode analog for now and remove it when bug is fixed
672                    //fix oboedit codebase error
673                    retval.add(createDbXref(xref, Dbxref.ANALOG));
674                }
675            }
676        }
677
678        //todo - remove this when bug is fixed
679        for (Object xrObj : obj.getDefDbxrefs()) {
680            Dbxref xref = (Dbxref) xrObj;
681            retval.add(createDbXref(xref, Dbxref.DEFINITION));
682        }
683
684        return retval;
685
686    }
687
688    /**
689     * helper method to create and populate a DbXrefBean object from an OBOEdit Dbxref object
690     *
691     * @param xref     - the OBOEdit object to extract information from
692     * @param xrefType - the xref type
693     * @return a valid OLS model DbXrefBean object
694     */
695    private DbXref createDbXref(Dbxref xref, int xrefType) {
696
697        DbXrefBean retval = new DbXrefBean();
698        retval.setDbName(safeTrim(xref.getDatabase()));
699        if (retval.getDbName() != null && retval.getDbName().length() > 255) {
700            logger.warn("dbxref dbname longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + retval.getDbName());
701            retval.setDbName(retval.getDbName().substring(0, 255));
702        }
703        //stupid oboeit artifact
704        if (xref.getDatabaseID() != null && !xref.getID().trim().equals("none")) {
705            retval.setAccession(safeTrim(xref.getDatabaseID()));
706//            if (retval.getAccession() != null && retval.getAccession().length() > 512) {
707            if (retval.getAccession() != null && retval.getAccession().length() > 256) {
708                System.out.println("retval.getAccession().length() = " + retval.getAccession().length());
709                logger.warn("dbxref accession longer than allowed database column length: " + retval.getAccession());
710                retval.setAccession(retval.getAccession().substring(0, 256));
711//                retval.setAccession(retval.getAccession().substring(0, 512));
712            }
713        }
714        //stupid oboeit artifact
715        if (xref.getDesc() != null && !xref.getDesc().trim().equals("none")) {
716            retval.setDescription(safeTrim(xref.getDesc()));
717            if (retval.getDescription() != null && retval.getDescription().length() > 2000) {
718                logger.warn("dbxref description longer than allowed database column length: " + retval.getDescription());
719                retval.setDescription(retval.getDescription().substring(0, 2000));
720            }
721        }
722        retval.setXrefType(xrefType);
723        return retval;
724
725    }
726
727    /**
728     * Once all the term objects have been created, this method will create the relationships and paths
729     * to link all the children terms to a given parent term and update the OLS TermBean object with
730     * the proper information from the global term storage.
731     *
732     * @param obj - the OBOEdit term object that will be used to extract information from
733     */
734    private void processTermRelationships(OBOObject obj) {
735
736        if (obj.getID().startsWith("obo:")) {
737            /*
738                obo:datatype
739                obo:property
740                obo:class
741            */
742            logger.debug("bogus term: " + obj.getID());
743            return;
744        }
745
746        TermBean trm = (TermBean) ontologyTerms.get(safeTrim(obj.getID()));
747        trm.setRelationships(processRelationships(obj, trm));
748        trm.setPaths(processPaths(obj, trm));
749
750        //update term object
751        ontologyTerms.put(trm.getIdentifier(), trm);
752    }
753
754    /**
755     * internal helper method to create TermRelationshipBeans for a given term.
756     * <pre>
757     *        term1
758     *            |_ child1        child1 IS_A term1
759     *            |_ child2        child2 IS_A term1
760     *                             subject pred object
761     * </pre>
762     *
763     * @param obj - the OBOEdit term object to extract information from
764     * @param trm - the OLS parent term to link to
765     * @return a Collection of valid TermRelationshipBeans
766     */
767    private Collection<TermRelationship> processRelationships(OBOObject obj, TermBean trm) {
768
769        HashSet<TermRelationship> retval = new HashSet<TermRelationship>();
770
771        Collection<Link> children = obj.getChildren();
772        for (Link lnk : children) {
773            //get the child term from the link
774            //use its ID to lookup in the map we created
775            //if null, continue
776            /*
777              term1
778                  |_ child1        child1 IS_A term1
779                  |_ child2        child2 IS_A term1
780                                   subject pred object
781            */
782            Term childTrm = ontologyTerms.get(safeTrim(lnk.getChild().getID()));
783            if (childTrm != null) {
784                TermRelationshipBean trb = new TermRelationshipBean();
785                trb.setSubjectTerm(childTrm);
786                trb.setObjectTerm(trm);
787
788                //set predicate type
789                if (IS_A_SET.contains(lnk.getType().getID())) {
790                    trb.setPredicateTerm(IS_A);
791                } else if (PART_OF_SET.contains(lnk.getType().getID())) {
792                    trb.setPredicateTerm(PART_OF);
793                } else if (DEV_FROM_SET.contains(lnk.getType().getID())) {
794                    trb.setPredicateTerm(DEVELOPS_FROM);
795                } else {
796                    TermBean otherRelation = getUnknownRelationTermBean(lnk.getType().getID());
797                    if (otherRelation != null) {
798                        trb.setPredicateTerm(otherRelation);
799                    } else {
800                        logger.warn("Unable to create unknown relation type: >" + lnk.getType().getID() + "<");
801                        continue;
802                    }
803                }
804                //set ontology
805                trb.setParentOntology(ontBean);
806                //add to retval
807                retval.add(trb);
808            } else {
809                logger.debug("No object term found for link: " + lnk.toString());
810            }
811        }
812        return retval;
813    }
814
815    /**
816     * helper method to create unknow relationship terms as they are required. These terms will also
817     * be added to the global term storage for persistence with the ontology.
818     *
819     * @param relationType - the string that defines the relationship from the ontology
820     * @return a valid TermBean
821     */
822    protected TermBean getUnknownRelationTermBean(String relationType) {
823
824        TermBean retval = null;
825        if (relationType != null) {
826            retval = (TermBean) unknown_relations.get(relationType.trim().toUpperCase());
827            if (retval == null) {
828                retval = initializeTermBean(relationType.trim(), Loader.RELATION_TYPE);
829                logger.info("Created unkonwn relation type: " + relationType);
830                unknown_relations.put(relationType.trim().toUpperCase(), retval);
831                //add to storage map so it'll get persisted with the rest
832                ontologyTerms.put(retval.getIdentifier(), retval);
833            }
834        }
835
836        return retval;
837
838    }
839
840    /**
841     * internal helper method to create TermPathBeans for a given term. This method will
842     * precompute all paths from a parent to all its children for the 3 major relationship types:
843     * IS_A, PART_OF and DEVELOPS_FROM. The PART_OF and DEVELOPS_FROM relations can traverse IS_A
844     * relations for maximal completeness and still be semantically correct, but IS_A relationships
845     * cannot traverse other relation types.
846     * <pre>
847     *        term1
848     *            |_ child1        child1 IS_A term1
849     *            |_ child2        child2 IS_A term1
850     *                             subject pred object
851     * </pre>
852     *
853     * @param obj - the OBOEdit term object to extract information from
854     * @param trm - the OLS parent term to link to
855     * @return a Collection of valid TermRelationshipBeans
856     */
857    private Collection<TermPath> processPaths(OBOObject obj, TermBean trm) {
858
859        HashSet<TermPath> retval = new HashSet<TermPath>();
860
861        HashMap<String, Integer> paths = parser.computeChildPaths(1, IS_A_SET, obj);
862        retval.addAll(createTermPathBeans(paths, Constants.IS_A_RELATION_TYPE_ID, IS_A, trm));
863
864        //the part_of relation can traverse is_a relations to generate term_paths
865        //so the set passed to computeChildPaths needs to contain both PART_OF and IS_A labels.
866        HashSet<String> traversingSet = new HashSet<String>();
867        traversingSet.addAll(PART_OF_SET);
868        traversingSet.addAll(IS_A_SET);
869        paths = parser.computeChildPaths(1, traversingSet, obj);
870        retval.addAll(createTermPathBeans(paths, Constants.PART_OF_RELATION_TYPE_ID, PART_OF, trm));
871
872        //the dev_from relation can traverse is_a relations to generate term_paths
873        //so the set passed to computeChildPaths needs to contain both DEV_FROM and IS_A labels.
874        traversingSet.clear();
875        traversingSet.addAll(DEV_FROM_SET);
876        traversingSet.addAll(IS_A_SET);
877        paths = parser.computeChildPaths(1, traversingSet, obj);
878        retval.addAll(createTermPathBeans(paths, Constants.DEVELOPS_FROM_RELATION_TYPE_ID, DEVELOPS_FROM, trm));
879
880        return retval;
881    }
882
883    /**
884     * Internal method that actually does all the precomputing of paths
885     */
886    private Collection<TermPath> createTermPathBeans(HashMap<String, Integer> paths, int relationTypeId,
887                                                     TermBean relationBean, TermBean trm)
888    {
889        HashSet<TermPath> retval = new HashSet<TermPath>();
890
891        //get the child term from the link
892        //use its ID to lookup in the map we created
893        //if null, continue
894        /*
895          term1
896              |_ child1        child1 IS_A term1
897              |_ child2        child2 IS_A term1
898                               subject pred object
899        */
900        Term objTrm;
901        for (String termId : paths.keySet()) {
902            //key = termID, value = distance
903            int distance = paths.get(termId);
904            objTrm = ontologyTerms.get(termId);
905            if (objTrm != null) {
906                //create bean
907                TermPathBean tpb = new TermPathBean();
908                //set distance
909                tpb.setDistance(distance);
910                //set subject term
911                tpb.setSubjectTerm(objTrm);
912                //set object
913                tpb.setObjectTerm(trm);
914                //set predicateTerm - is_a, part_of, develops_from
915                tpb.setPredicateTerm(relationBean);
916                //set relationshipType
917                tpb.setRelationshipTypeId((long) relationTypeId);
918                //set ontology
919                tpb.setParentOntology(ontBean);
920                //add to retval
921                retval.add(tpb);
922            } else {
923                logger.debug("No object term found for term path: " + trm.getIdentifier() + "->" + termId);
924            }
925        }
926        return retval;
927    }
928
929    private String getSynonymTypeDef(int scope) {
930        switch (scope) {
931            case Synonym.EXACT_SYNONYM:
932                return "Exact synonym type";
933            case Synonym.NARROW_SYNONYM:
934                return "Narrow synonym type";
935            case Synonym.BROAD_SYNONYM:
936                return "Broad synonym type";
937            case Synonym.RELATED_SYNONYM:
938                return "Related synonym type";
939            case Synonym.UNKNOWN_SCOPE:
940            default:
941                return "Unknown synonym type";
942        }
943    }
944
945
946    /**
947     * Builds the synonyms for a given term
948     *
949     * @param obj OBOObject representing the term
950     * @param trm TermBean to link to the TermSynonym objects being created
951     * @return a collection of properly constructed and linked TermSynonymBean objects
952     */
953    private Collection<TermSynonym> processSynonyms(OBOObject obj, TermBean trm) {
954
955        HashSet<TermSynonym> retval = new HashSet<TermSynonym>();
956
957        //loop over synonyms
958        Set<Synonym> syns = obj.getSynonyms();
959        int synCount = 1;
960        for (Synonym aSyn : syns) {
961
962            TermSynonymBean tsb = new TermSynonymBean();
963            //link parent term
964            tsb.setParentTerm(trm);
965
966            String synVal = safeTrim(aSyn.getText());
967            if (synVal != null) {
968
969                //set value
970                tsb.setSynonym(synVal);
971
972                if (synVal.length() > 2000) {
973                    logger.warn("synonym value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
974                    tsb.setSynonym(tsb.getSynonym().substring(0, 2000));
975                }
976
977                //check to see if there's a defined synonymType for it
978                if (aSyn.getSynonymType() != null) {
979
980                    logger.debug("using user-defined synonym type: " + aSyn.getSynonymType().getName());
981                    Term synTrm = ontologyTerms.get(aSyn.getSynonymType().getID());
982                    if (synTrm != null) {
983                        tsb.setSynonymType(synTrm);
984                    } else {
985                        throw new IllegalStateException(
986                                "Attempting to use user-defined synonym type that has not been initialized in common objects: "
987                                        + aSyn.getSynonymType().getID()
988                        );
989                    }
990
991                } else {
992
993                    //logger.debug("using old-style synonym types");
994                    //link synonymType Term
995                    switch (aSyn.getScope()) {
996                        case Synonym.EXACT_SYNONYM:
997                            tsb.setSynonymType(EXACT);
998                            break;
999                        case Synonym.NARROW_SYNONYM:
1000                            tsb.setSynonymType(NARROW);
1001                            break;
1002                        case Synonym.BROAD_SYNONYM:
1003                            tsb.setSynonymType(BROAD);
1004                            break;
1005                        case Synonym.RELATED_SYNONYM:
1006                            tsb.setSynonymType(RELATED);
1007                            break;
1008                        case Synonym.UNKNOWN_SCOPE:
1009                        default:
1010                            tsb.setSynonymType(SYNONYM);
1011                            break;
1012                    }
1013
1014                }
1015
1016                Collection<Dbxref> oboSynXrefs = aSyn.getXrefs();
1017                if (oboSynXrefs != null) {
1018                    Collection<DbXref> xrefs = new HashSet<DbXref>();
1019                    for (Dbxref xref : oboSynXrefs) {
1020                        xrefs.add(createDbXref(xref, Dbxref.RELATED_SYNONYM));
1021                    }
1022                    tsb.setSynonymXrefs(xrefs);
1023                }
1024
1025                //set synonym primary key because it is no longer being set by OJB
1026                //use syncount to avoid tsb hashcode collisions for a single trm
1027                tsb.setSynonymPk(SHORT_NAME + (synCount++ * tsb.hashCode()) + "!" + trm.getTermPk());
1028                if (tsb.getSynonymPk().length() > 255) {
1029                    throw new IllegalStateException("synonym PK longer than allowed database column length: " + tsb.getSynonymPk());
1030                }
1031
1032                //add TermSynonym to retval collection
1033                retval.add(tsb);
1034
1035            } else {
1036                logger.debug("Null Synonym value encountered for " + trm.getIdentifier());
1037            }
1038
1039        }
1040
1041        //check for alt_ids
1042        Set<String> altIDs = obj.getSecondaryIDs();
1043        String altID;
1044        for ( Iterator<String> i = altIDs.iterator(); i.hasNext(); ) {
1045            altID = i.next();
1046            TermSynonymBean tsb = new TermSynonymBean();
1047            //link parent term
1048            tsb.setParentTerm(trm);
1049            //set def
1050            tsb.setSynonym(safeTrim(altID));
1051            if (altID != null && altID.length() > 2000) {
1052                logger.warn("synonym value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
1053                tsb.setSynonym(tsb.getSynonym().substring(0, 2000));
1054            }
1055
1056            //set synType
1057            tsb.setSynonymType(ALT_ID);
1058
1059            //set synonym primary key because it is no longer being set by OJB
1060            //use syncount to avoid tsb hashcode collisions for a single trm
1061            tsb.setSynonymPk(SHORT_NAME + (synCount++ * tsb.hashCode()) + "!" + trm.getTermPk());
1062            if (tsb.getSynonymPk().length() > 255) {
1063                throw new IllegalStateException("synonym PK longer than allowed database column length: " + tsb.getSynonymPk());
1064            }
1065
1066            //add TermSynonym to retval collection
1067            retval.add(tsb);
1068        }
1069
1070        //if main termID is URL, eg http://www.ebi.ac.uk/EFO_1234
1071        //add synonym with just final portion of URL, eg EFO_1234
1072        try {
1073            if (trm.getIdentifier().toLowerCase().startsWith("http:")) {
1074                altID = trm.getIdentifier().substring(trm.getIdentifier().lastIndexOf("/") + 1);
1075
1076                TermSynonymBean tsb = new TermSynonymBean();
1077                //link parent term
1078                tsb.setParentTerm(trm);
1079                //set def
1080                tsb.setSynonym(safeTrim(altID));
1081                if (altID != null && altID.length() > 2000) {
1082                    logger.warn("synonym value longer than allowed database column length - truncating " + trm.getIdentifier());
1083                    tsb.setSynonym(tsb.getSynonym().substring(0, 2000));
1084                }
1085
1086                //set synType
1087                tsb.setSynonymType(ALT_ID);
1088
1089                //set synonym primary key because it is no longer being set by OJB
1090                //use syncount to avoid tsb hashcode collisions for a single trm
1091                tsb.setSynonymPk(SHORT_NAME + (synCount++ * tsb.hashCode()) + "!" + trm.getTermPk());
1092                if (tsb.getSynonymPk().length() > 255) {
1093                    throw new IllegalStateException("synonym PK longer than allowed database column length: " + tsb.getSynonymPk());
1094                }
1095
1096                //add TermSynonym to retval collection
1097                retval.add(tsb);
1098
1099            }
1100        } catch (IndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
1101            logger.debug("Could not create alt_id from URL from term: " + trm.getIdentifier());
1102        }
1103
1104        return retval;
1105    }
1106
1107    /**
1108     * for debugging
1109     */
1110    protected void dumpOntology() {
1111
1112        for (String id : getRootTerms()) {
1113            logger.debug("Root term: " + id);
1114            dumpTerm(ontologyTerms.get(id), "");
1115        }
1116    }
1117
1118    /**
1119     * for debugging
1120     */
1121    protected void dumpOntologyStats() {
1122
1123        int ts = 0, tp = 0, tr = 0, ta = 0;
1124        for (Term tb : ontologyTerms.values()) {
1125
1126            if (tb.getSynonyms() != null) {
1127                ts += tb.getSynonyms().size();
1128            }
1129            if (tb.getPaths() != null) {
1130                tp += tb.getPaths().size();
1131            }
1132            if (tb.getRelationships() != null) {
1133                tr += tb.getRelationships().size();
1134            }
1135            if (tb.getAnnotations() != null) {
1136                ta += tb.getAnnotations().size();
1137            }
1138        }
1139
1140        logger.info("Number of terms: " + ontologyTerms.size());
1141        logger.info("Number of synonyms: " + ts);
1142        logger.info("Number of relationships: " + tr);
1143        logger.info("Number of paths: " + tp);
1144        logger.info("Number of annotations: " + ta);
1145
1146    }
1147
1148
1149    /**
1150     * for debugging
1151     *
1152     * @param term   - term to dump
1153     * @param indent - spaces to indent
1154     */
1155    protected void dumpTerm(Term term, String indent) {
1156
1157        if (indent.length() > 15) {
1158            return;
1159        }
1160        if (term != null) {
1161            logger.debug(indent + "id: " + term.getIdentifier());
1162            logger.debug(indent + "name: " + term.getName());
1163            if (term.getSynonyms() != null)
1164                logger.debug(indent + "nb syn: " + term.getSynonyms().size());
1165            if (term.getAnnotations() != null)
1166                logger.debug(indent + "nb annot: " + term.getAnnotations().size());
1167            if (term.getRelationships() != null) {
1168                for (TermRelationship tr : term.getRelationships()) {
1169                    String relationStr = indent + tr.getSubjectTerm().getName() + " " + tr.getPredicateTerm().getName() + " " + tr.getObjectTerm().getName();
1170                    logger.debug(relationStr);
1171                    dumpTerm(tr.getSubjectTerm(), indent + " ");
1172                }
1173            }
1174        }
1175    }
1176
1177    /**
1178     * takes a string and trims whitespace. if resulting string is empty, return null;
1179     *
1180     * @param inStr string to trim; if null, return null
1181     */
1182    protected String safeTrim(String inStr) {
1183        if (inStr != null) {
1184            String tmp = inStr.trim();
1185            if (tmp.length() > 0) {
1186                return tmp;
1187            } else {
1188                return null;
1189            }
1190        } else {
1191            return null;
1192        }
1193    }
1194
1195    /**
1196     * returns the OntologyAccess that has been loaded from file.
1197     *
1198     * @return returns the OntologyAccess that has been loaded from file.
1199     * @throws IllegalStateException if the bean has not been properly initialized.
1200     */
1201    public Ontology getOntology() throws IOException {
1202        if (ontBean != null)
1203            return ontBean;
1204        else {
1205            throw new IllegalStateException("OntologyAccess bean not properly initialized. " +
1206              "Did you call the proper sequence of methods: configure(), parse(), process()?");
1207        }
1208    }
1209
1210}
